ARABIC: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore that they would harvest in the
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We have put them [i.e., the Makkans] to test even as We put to test the owners of the orchard when they vowed that they would gather the fruit of their orchard in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have tested them in the same way as we tested the dwellers of the garden (in Yemen) when they swore to pluck all the fruits of the garden in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed tested them the way We had tested the owners of the garden when they swore that they would reap its harvest the next morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We will try them as We tried the owners of the garden, when they swore that they would certainly cut off the produce in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Now We have tried them, even as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore they would pluck in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have tried them as we tried the owners of a certain orchard, who vowed to harvest all its fruits the next morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We! We have proved them even as We proved the fellows of a garden when they swarethat they would surely reap it in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed we have tested them just as We tested the People of the Garden when they vowed they would gather its fruit at dawn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We have tried them as We tried the people of the garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits of the (garden) in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden who had sworn that in the morning they would reap it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We tested them, as We tested the owners of the garden, when they vowed to harvest it in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:17] Indeed We have tried them, We have tested the people of Mecca with drought and famine, just as We tried the owners of the garden, the orchard, when they vowed that they would pluck, [that] they would pick its fruits, in the morning, so that the poor folk would not notice them and so that they would not then have to give them of it that [portion] which their father used to give them of it by way of charity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! we have tried them) We have tried the people of Mecca with death, captivity and defeat on the Day of Badr because they refrained from asking forgiveness and We tried them with hunger and drought for a period of seven years because the Prophet, Allah bless him and give peace, prayed against them on the Day of Badr (as We tried) with hunger and the burning of the gardens (the owners of the garden) the owners of the fields: the Banu Darwan (when they vowed) when they swore by Allah (they would pluck its fruit next morning) at the break of dawn.
